meanings.definition: To move at a pace faster than a walk
meanings.sent1: The dog trotted happily in the park.
meanings.sent2: The horse trotted along the trail.
meanings.sent3: The cat trotted after a butterfly, looking quite determined.
meanings.sent4: The children trotted to the playground, full of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel trotted up the tree, agile and quick.

meanings.definition: To run or jog at a moderate speed
meanings.sent1: She trotted lightly on the treadmill at the gym.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trotted around the track for warm-up.
meanings.sent3: The bear trotted comically in a silly dance.
meanings.sent4: The clouds trotted across the sky, casting shadows below.
meanings.sent5: The river trotted over the rocks, creating a soothing sound.
